message:
So far, I've just done my validation at the boundaries. It depends on how defensive you want to get; you *can* define your own property setters to ensure validation is still complete, but then you can also have situations where you need to set multiple properties before the object can be considered valid, and I'm not wild about temporarily turning off validation and then turning it back on. There isn't a great solution that handles everything ATM.

Good point about the domain vs technical limitation. It would be great if our domains could ignore technical limitations, but it's usually more painful to have that kind of exception happen at the storage layer instead of as close as possible to the user. So, I usually do propagate technical limitations up.
